name: JD Vance
bio: J.D. Vance is the 50th Vice President of the United States. He previously served as U.S. Senator from Ohio (2023–2025), worked in venture capital, authored 'Hillbilly Elegy,' and served in the Marine Corps. His focus has been on revitalizing U.S. industry, tech accountability, and national sovereignty.
education: Ohio State University (BA), Yale Law School (JD)
platform: Rebuild American industry, protect working families, strengthen national sovereignty.

platformFollowThrough.Industry: Advanced incentives for reshoring manufacturing and critical supply chains.
platformFollowThrough.Tech Accountability: Backed antitrust scrutiny and hearings on platform power.
platformFollowThrough.Border: Supported enhanced federal resources for border enforcement.

name: Marco Rubio
bio: Marco Rubio is the 71st U.S. Secretary of State. He served as U.S. Senator from Florida (2011–2025) and Speaker of the Florida House (2006–2008). His work has focused on foreign policy, human rights, China strategy, and Western Hemisphere security.
education: University of Florida (BA), University of Miami (JD)
platform: Strengthen alliances, counter China, assert U.S. leadership in the Western Hemisphere and Indo‑Pacific.

platformFollowThrough.Alliances: Initiated NATO consultations and expanded Baltic security cooperation.
platformFollowThrough.Indo-Pacific: Convened dialogues with Quad partners on maritime security.
platformFollowThrough.Western Hemisphere: Launched high-level engagements on security and trade.

name: Scott Bessent
bio: Scott Bessent is the 78th U.S. Secretary of the Treasury. He is a financier and investor, previously CIO at Soros Fund Management and founder of Key Square Group, with deep experience in macro strategy, currency markets, and risk management.
platform: Pro‑growth tax policy, capital markets stability, strong dollar.

platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Discipline: Established interagency review of discretionary spending.
platformFollowThrough.Dollar: Reaffirmed strong‑dollar policy for confidence and stability.

name: Pete Hegseth
bio: Pete Hegseth is the 29th U.S. Secretary of Defense. A former Army National Guard officer with deployments to Iraq and Afghanistan, he has advocated for veterans, readiness, and procurement reform.
platform: Increase readiness, modernize forces, streamline procurement.

platformFollowThrough.Readiness: Expanded unit training cycles and joint exercises.
platformFollowThrough.Modernization: Initiated portfolio review on ISR, air defense, unmanned systems.
platformFollowThrough.Procurement: Formed working group to cut acquisition timelines and overruns.

name: Pam Bondi
bio: Pam Bondi is the 86th Attorney General of the United States. Former Florida Attorney General (2011–2019), she focused on consumer protection, public integrity, and criminal justice.
education: University of Florida (BA), Stetson University College of Law (JD)
platform: Public integrity, border enforcement, organized crime disruption.

platformFollowThrough.Integrity: Stood up DOJ ethics review unit to enhance oversight.
platformFollowThrough.Border: Prioritized prosecution of transnational smuggling networks.
platformFollowThrough.Crime: Expanded task forces targeting cyber fraud and organized theft.

name: Doug Burgum
bio: Doug Burgum is the 53rd Secretary of the Interior. He previously served as Governor of North Dakota (2016–2024) and built a career in software and venture capital. His leadership emphasizes energy development, land stewardship, and tribal consultation.
education: North Dakota State University (BA), Stanford University (MBA)
platform: Expand domestic energy, streamline land management, strengthen tribal partnerships.

platformFollowThrough.Energy: Approved new drilling leases on federal lands.
platformFollowThrough.Land: Reduced permitting timelines for multi‑use projects.
platformFollowThrough.Tribal: Opened new consultation channels with tribal governments.

name: Brooke Rollins
bio: Brooke Rollins is the 33rd Secretary of Agriculture. She previously led the White House Domestic Policy Council and the Texas Public Policy Foundation. Her focus is on rural prosperity, deregulation, and agricultural innovation.
education: Texas A&M University (BA), University of Texas School of Law (JD)
platform: Rural development, market access, ag‑tech innovation.

platformFollowThrough.Broadband: Expanded USDA broadband grants for rural communities.
platformFollowThrough.Exports: Streamlined export certifications for U.S. producers.

name: Howard Lutnick
bio: Howard Lutnick is the 41st Secretary of Commerce. He is CEO of Cantor Fitzgerald and has decades of experience in financial services. His priorities include trade competitiveness, capital formation, and regulatory clarity.
platform: Expand trade, deregulate, and promote entrepreneurship.

platformFollowThrough.Trade: Opened bilateral talks on new sectoral agreements.

name: Lori Chavez-DeRemer
bio: Lori Chavez-DeRemer is the 30th Secretary of Labor. She previously served as U.S. Representative for Oregon’s 5th district and as mayor of Happy Valley, Oregon. She emphasizes workforce training, union transparency, and deregulation.
platform: Workforce training, union reform, deregulation.

platformFollowThrough.Union Reform: Proposed new transparency rules for unions.

name: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
office: Secretary of Health and Human Services
bio: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is the 31st Secretary of Health and Human Services. An environmental lawyer and activist, he is known for his work on water quality and vaccine policy. As HHS Secretary, he oversees federal health programs and public health policy.
education: Harvard College (BA), University of Virginia (JD), Pace University (LLM)
platform: Expand medical freedom, reduce regulatory capture, promote environmental health.

platformFollowThrough.Medical Freedom: Announced review of vaccine approval processes.
platformFollowThrough.Regulatory Reform: Ordered audit of FDA advisory committees.
platformFollowThrough.Environmental Health: Launched initiative linking pollution reduction to chronic disease prevention.

name: Scott Turner
office: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development
bio: Scott Turner is the 19th HUD Secretary. A former Texas legislator and executive director of the White House Opportunity and Revitalization Council, he’s focused on neighborhood revitalization, affordable housing supply, and public‑private partnerships that unlock investment in distressed communities.
platform: Opportunity zones, housing supply growth, local‑private revitalization.

platformFollowThrough.Supply: Announced block grants tied to streamlined local permitting and zoning updates.
platformFollowThrough.Investment: Enhanced reporting incentives for Opportunity Zone projects with community benchmarks.
platformFollowThrough.Revitalization: Launched city partnerships to expand workforce housing and mixed‑use redevelopment.

name: Sean Duffy
bio: Sean Duffy is the 20th Transportation Secretary. A former U.S. Representative, he’s prioritizing faster project delivery, safety outcomes, and resilient freight corridors to reduce bottlenecks affecting consumers and manufacturers.
platform: Deliver infrastructure, improve safety metrics, optimize freight logistics.

platformFollowThrough.Delivery: Published accelerated permitting playbook for state DOTs and MPOs.
platformFollowThrough.Safety: Expanded grade‑crossing and roadway safety audits with target metrics.
platformFollowThrough.Freight: Convened national logistics roundtables to coordinate ports, rail, and trucking.

name: Chris Wright
bio: Chris Wright is the 17th Energy Secretary. An engineer and energy executive, he’s focused on reliability, affordability, and durable U.S. energy independence across oil, gas, nuclear, and emerging technologies.
education: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (BS), University of California, Berkeley (MS, PhD)
platform: Expand domestic production, modernize grids, support advanced nuclear.

platformFollowThrough.Production: Approved targeted upstream leases and midstream infrastructure to increase throughput.
platformFollowThrough.Grid: Backed reliability standards and transmission upgrades.
platformFollowThrough.Nuclear: Encouraged SMR pilot pathways and supply chain readiness.

name: Linda McMahon
bio: Linda McMahon is the 12th Education Secretary. Former SBA Administrator and business leader, she’s advancing school choice pathways, career and technical education, and accountability that reduces compliance burden while tracking outcomes.
platform: Expand choice, elevate vocational/CTE, limit federal overreach.

platformFollowThrough.Choice: Boosted charter and scholarship grant programs with performance reporting.
platformFollowThrough.CTE: Launched apprenticeship initiatives with measurable local placement outcomes.
platformFollowThrough.Accountability: Reviewed guidance to streamline district compliance.

name: Doug Collins
bio: Doug Collins is the 12th Veterans Affairs Secretary. A former Congressman and Air Force chaplain, he’s focused on access to care, claims processing speed, and performance accountability across VA facilities.
education: University of North Georgia (BA), New Orleans Baptist Theological Seminary (MDiv), John Marshall Law School (JD)
platform: Improve veteran care, modernize systems, strengthen accountability.

platformFollowThrough.Care: Expanded telehealth and mental‑health access points with service targets.
platformFollowThrough.Systems: Accelerated electronic health record improvements tied to facility readiness.
platformFollowThrough.Accountability: Enhanced performance reviews and transparent service metrics.

name: Kristi Noem
bio: Kristi Noem is the 8th Homeland Security Secretary. A former governor and member of Congress, she’s focused on border infrastructure, targeted enforcement against transnational networks, and cyber/critical infrastructure resilience.
platform: Secure borders, enforce immigration laws, protect critical infrastructure.

platformFollowThrough.Border: Restarted barrier construction and surveillance upgrades in priority sectors.
platformFollowThrough.Enforcement: Expanded operations against smuggling and trafficking networks.
platformFollowThrough.Cyber: Coordinated cyber resilience exercises with critical‑infrastructure partners.

name: Lee Zeldin
office: Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency
bio: Lee Zeldin is the 16th EPA Administrator. A former Congressman, he’s focused on clean air and water protection, permitting clarity, and data‑driven accountability for enforcement actions.
platform: Clean water infrastructure, streamlined permitting, enforcement transparency.

platformFollowThrough.Water: Announced clean water infrastructure grant expansions with regional prioritization.
platformFollowThrough.Permitting: Scaled back duplicative environmental reviews and timelines.
platformFollowThrough.Transparency: Published enforcement dashboards to track actions and outcomes.

name: Russell Vought
office: Director of the Office of Management and Budget
bio: Russell Vought leads OMB with a focus on spending discipline, budget transparency, and regulatory impact analysis. He previously served as OMB Director (2020–2021) and heads a public policy institute.
education: Wheaton College (BA), George Washington University Law School (JD)
platform: Fiscal restraint, transparent dashboards, rigorous regulatory review.

platformFollowThrough.Restraint: Proposed baseline savings targets with program‑level reviews.
platformFollowThrough.Transparency: Published dashboards detailing budget execution and variance.

name: Tulsi Gabbard
bio: Tulsi Gabbard is the 8th DNI. A former U.S. Representative and Army National Guard officer, she’s focused on intelligence integration, counterterrorism, and cyber defense across federal and allied partners.
platform: Integrate intelligence, enhance cyber readiness, expand transparency where appropriate.

platformFollowThrough.Integration: Ordered inter‑agency improvements to information sharing and joint assessments.
platformFollowThrough.Cyber: Launched joint cyber defense initiatives with sector partners.
platformFollowThrough.Transparency: Expanded unclassified threat briefings to inform public resilience.

name: Jamieson Greer
bio: Jamieson Greer is the 20th USTR. A former USTR Chief of Staff and international trade attorney, he’s advancing fair trade enforcement, strategic tariff policy, and incentives for domestic manufacturing and resilient supply chains.
education: Brigham Young University (BA), George Washington University Law School (JD)
platform: Fair trade enforcement, selective tariffs on adversaries, reshoring.

platformFollowThrough.Enforcement: Expanded actions targeting unfair practices affecting key sectors.
platformFollowThrough.Tariffs: Adjusted rates on strategic imports tied to national interests.
platformFollowThrough.Reshoring: Negotiated incentives linked to domestic production commitments.

name: Kelly Loeffler
office: Administrator of the Small Business Administration
bio: Kelly Loeffler is the 27th SBA Administrator. A former U.S. Senator and financial executive, she’s focused on capital access for small firms, simplified compliance, and mentorship networks that scale entrepreneurship.
platform: Expand lending, reduce compliance burdens, scale mentorship.

platformFollowThrough.Lending: Expanded loan guarantees with streamlined underwriting for micro/SME borrowers.
platformFollowThrough.Compliance: Simplified reporting thresholds for small enterprises.
platformFollowThrough.Mentorship: Bolstered SBDC and SCORE networks with digital access.

name: Susie Wiles
bio: Susie Wiles is the White House Chief of Staff. A veteran campaign strategist, she coordinates West Wing operations, aligns agency priorities, and manages legislative outreach to support the administration’s agenda.
platform: Operational discipline, strategic alignment, communications coherence.

platformFollowThrough.Operations: Reorganized senior staff lanes and decision workflows.
platformFollowThrough.Comms: Integrated policy rollout calendars with press planning.

name: Karoline Leavitt
bio: Karoline Leavitt is the White House Press Secretary. A former House communications staffer and congressional candidate, she manages daily briefings, message discipline, and rapid media response.
platform: Transparent briefings, rapid response, disciplined messaging.

platformFollowThrough.Briefings: Instituted regular on‑camera briefings with supporting fact sheets.
platformFollowThrough.Response: Built rapid rebuttal processes for breaking narratives.
platformFollowThrough.Discipline: Aligned agency talking points with policy rollouts.
